text:
Hello,

due to restrictions by my server provider, I have to run java with the 
parameter -Xmx24m.

If I try to run ant it produces the same error:

Error occurred during initialization of VM
Could not reserve enough space for object heap
Could not create the Java virtual machine.

How can I force ant to run java with the parameter -Xmx24m ?

Sorry for contacting you this way, but I couldn't find any other possibility.

Greets, Sven.
creator: d.s.raven@gmx.de

text:
Hint,
there is a mailing list!
use ANT_OPTS in your .bashrc file
example:
export ANT_OPTS="-Xms200m -Xmx1000m"
creator: peterreilly@apache.org

text:
Is the problem that Ant wont run with a 24MB heap? If so, its probably true, and
there is not much that we can do about it. You may be able to try different XML
parsers to find one more efficient than Xerces, but tuning Ant to work in
small-footprint systems is, I am afraid to say, not a current activity.
creator: stevel@apache.org

text:
Excluding those written specifically for J2ME, I doubt that there are many Java
apps that could run with a max heap of 24M; the default max heap is 64M.
creator: carej@us.ibm.com
